items.content_html: Pulled a trigger. Just moved instances - again. This time though from my beloved social.lol to my own, social.yeswas.pl. Nothing is required from you, just please enjoy the flow of ~the content~ into your timeline.

items.content_html: I’m also very fine with using micro.blog apps to post to Mastodon. The only issue is that I’d like to be able to use Ivory on my mac and it’s going to suck when I can’t (I mean, I can, but then it goes just to my Mastodon) post stuff from it.

items.content_html: It has already been a month and a half of me having my own blog, under my own domain, with all of my content being then distributed to “other platforms” (hello Mastodon!). Micro.blog is great!

items.content_html: Ok, apparently not everything went as smooth as I’d like it to, but having backups before doing any changes is once again something that saves my ass. Seems to me like Discourse didn’t change links to uploaded data, so when I got rid off /uploads, they are 404ing. Understandable.

items.content_html: Great evening, full of coding and administrative work. I’ve finally moved all of the images from forum.yeswas.pl onto B2’s Backblaze. And I gave Mastodon on my own another go, this time from source and works flawlessly! This is… promissing?

items.content_html: Got this Belkin thing (thanks Kamil!) to put your phone on your Mac so it acts like a Webcam. First of all - it weights a bit so can easily move screen back - it has to be in a certain spot to works. But when it works… Works like a charm. Quality is excellent.

items.content_html: Hot take: I’d like to use an opinionated Mastodon client with algorythmic timeline. No idea how this timeline should work to be useful but I liked being able to see what machine thinks I’d enjoy (and sometimes it even was right!). Easily would pay for it couple bucks monthly.

items.content_html:
Starting February 9, we will no longer support free access to the Twitter API, both v2 and v1.1. A paid basic tier will be available instead. ‚Äî Twitter Dev

Twitter is effectively killing every free tool built for it, including autoposters, autoblockers and deleters.
items.content_text:
> Starting February 9, we will no longer support free access to the Twitter API, both v2 and v1.1. A paid basic tier will be available instead. ‚Äî [Twitter Dev](https://twitter.com/TwitterDev/status/1621026986784337922)

Twitter is effectively killing every free tool built for it, including autoposters, autoblockers and deleters.

items.content_html: Always on the edge when it comes to the browser choice. I love Arq but Safari is quicker, has better integration with system (Apple Pay anyone?) and has great mobile version. On the other hand - Arc has extensions, that aren’t ported to Safari (yet, or never will be!).

items.content_html: I’ve decided against buying an older phone (13 Pro) and I’m unable to spend that amount of money to get 14 Pro. I wanted to have better battery so 14 Plus it is. My wife is gonna get my 11 Pro (she has SE, so that’s an upgrade). In case of great September I’m still open:)

items.content_html: My own (social.Orzech.me) instance of Mastodon is becoming really, really big. Without my input it grew to 8GB of disk space. That‚Äôs‚Ä¶ not optimistic. Not sure if I‚Äôm gonna keep it around then. I might try Pleroma or Misskey instead so it‚Äôs a bit lighter on resources?

Here’s for the next one!

items.content_html: Micro.blog meta: It would be nice if this new post window from mac app could be invoked with some global shortcut. It would make posting much, much easier.

items.content_html:
I‚Äôm gonna be so fucked in the morning but I did - from my phone - moved my blog from Wordpress to Micro.blog, added custom domain, configured all of the cross-posts and did basically everything to have this punt.pl be the centre of my universe. Once again. Because I remember how it went like two weeks ago.

Feels great.
